header.title: phpBB Social Network Core
header.description:
The phpBB3 Social Network is modification for phpBB3 boards, which turns your board to full valued social network software. This modification is modular based, it means admin can switch on/off each module. phpBB3 Social Network will create your own small "Facebook" page with all main features of social network such as : extended profiles with all informations about person, personal galleries, user statuses with comments, Friends approval system with friendlist, main page looking like facebook main page, private Instant messenger, creating events and inviting others, writing own blogs, notifications about your friends activities, "sharing" and "likeing" and even more.
phpBB Social Network Core 0.5.1 includes these modules: 1. Instant Messenger - this module adds private chat similar to Facebook chat with all features. 2. User status / Wall - this module adds wall to the profile of all users. Users can add their own statuses and others can comment them. 3. Friends approval system - this module adds approval system for friends and friendlist to user's profile. Users can send the request if they want to add a friend and the request has to be approved by the other side. 4. Main Page module - this module is similar to Facebook main page. It means, it collects new updates about statuses, comments, friendships etc. from all your friends or all users, it depends on administrator.
header.author-notes:
Update from 0.5.0 to 0.5.1 has just 4 simple steps: 1) copy all files from the root/ file to your FTP root path and rewrite old files 2) follow edit instructions below 3) run socialnet/update_database.php in your browser 4) purge the cache and refresh template and skin via ACP
Feel free to ask for support or more modules here http://socialnetwork.phpbb3hacks.com/

action-group.diy-instructions: When you copy all new files to your board, do all edits above and run installation via update_database.php, do not forget to clear the cache and refresh your template. Then set up the user permissions.
